Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Three-dimensional interconnected cages with flexible windows

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Cooperative/competitive adsorption driven by adsorbate-adsorbate interactions within hydrophobic pores.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 313 K; Ethanol partial pressure: 360 Pa; 1-Butanol partial pressure: 40, 80, or 125 Pa; Flow rate: 40 mL/min
Other Information.Additional Info: Increased equilibrium capacity in the presence of 1-butanol at certain conditions (e.g., ethanol partial pressure 500-1500 Pa with 1-butanol partial pressure 10 Pa), and decreased capacity at higher ethanol partial pressures. Faster breakthrough compared to 1-butanol due to lower adsorption affinity.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Cooperative/competitive adsorption driven by adsorbate-adsorbate interactions within hydrophobic pores.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 313 K; 1-Butanol partial pressure: 40, 80, or 125 Pa; Ethanol partial pressure: 360 Pa; Flow rate: 40 mL/min
Other Information.Additional Info: Increased equilibrium capacity in the presence of ethanol; observed 'roll-up' effect during desorption linked to ethanol removal and cooperative adsorption. Slower breakthrough compared to ethanol due to higher adsorption affinity.

Sieving Mechanism: Adsorption-driven separation based on competitive and cooperative effects between alcohol molecules within hydrophobic pores.

Experimental Validation.Method: Gravimetric adsorption measurements, Grand Canonical Monte Carlo (GCMC) simulations, Breakthrough experiments (packed column)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Saturation capacities: 3.9 mmol/g for 1-butanol, 5.8 mmol/g for ethanol. Cooperative adsorption leads to increased equilibrium capacities for both alcohols in mixtures under certain conditions. Observed 'roll-up' effect for 1-butanol during desorption.

Other Information.Additional Info: ZIF-8 possesses structural flexibility, allowing for a 0.5 Å increase in pore entrance at high pressures (>1.47 GPa) due to linker rotation, but this flexibility was found to have little influence on the adsorption equilibrium of alcohols in this study. Material prepared as pellets (250-500 µm) and studied for adsorptive recovery of alcohols from vapor phase.
